summary: Email correspondence from attorney Stuart Kaplan to federal prosecutors regarding his client, a retired FBI Special Agent, who has been subpoenaed to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The attorney raises concerns about the client's ability to prepare for testimony without access to her original interview notes and mentions a prior OPR interview.

persons.name: Stuart Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney representing a retired FBI Special Agent who has been subpoenaed to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. He is communicating with federal prosecutors about his client's concerns regarding testimony preparation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell' pending in the Southern District of New York, for which a retired FBI agent has been subpoenaed to testify.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His investigation is referenced as the subject of the retired FBI agent's recollection during an OPR interview.

connections.description: Kaplan states he has been retained by the retired FBI Special Agent to represent her in connection with her subpoena to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The retired agent was involved in the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, as referenced in her OPR interview.
The retired agent has been subpoenaed to testify in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Attorney Email Regarding Witness Preparation
events.description: Attorney Stuart Kaplan emails federal prosecutors to raise concerns about his client, a retired FBI agent, being unable to properly prepare for her testimony in the Ghislaine Maxwell case without access to her original interview notes.

events.title: OPR Interview of Retired FBI Agent
events.description: Prior to her retirement, the FBI agent was interviewed under oath by the Office of Professional Responsibility regarding her recollection of events in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: A retired FBI Special Agent has been subpoenaed to testify in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

The agent's attorney, Stuart Kaplan, is concerned she cannot properly prepare for testimony because she has not been given a copy of her original interview notes (1A notes) that preceded an FD-302 report.
The retired agent was previously interviewed under oath by the FBI's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) about her recollection of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
The attorney requests that all future contact with his client be coordinated through his office.
